HelpXML.Title: HYPpsi
HelpXML.Purpose: HYPpsi computes psi function for hyperbolic tangent estimator

Item.Name: u
Item.LongDesc: n x 1 vector containing residuals or Mahalanobis distances for the n units of the sample

Item.Name: cktuning
Item.TypeInd: Vector of length 2 or of length 5

Item.Name: psiHYP
Item.TypeInd: FULL STOP MISSING IN THE OUTPUT DESCRIPTION
Item.LongDesc: Values of hyperbolic psi function associated to the residuals or Mahalanobis distances for the n units of the sample

HelpXML.MoreAbout:
Function HYPpsi transforms vector u as follows
\[ HYPpsi(u) = \left\{ \begin{array}{cc} u & |u| \leq d \\ \sqrt{A (k - 1)} \tanh \left( \sqrt{(k - 1) B^2/A} (c -|u|)/2 \right) sign(u) & d \leq |u| < c, \\ 0 & |u| \geq c. \end{array} \right. \] It is necessary to have $0 < A < B < 2 normcdf(c)-1- 2 c \times normpdf(c) <1$

References.Item: Hampel F.R., Rousseeuw P.J. and Ronchetti E. (1981), The Change-of-Variance Curve and Optimal Redescending M-Estimators, Journal of the American Statistical Association , Vol. 76, No. 375, pp. 643-648 (HRR)
Riani M., Cerioli A., Atkinson A.C., Perrotta D. (2014). Monitoring Robust Regression. Electronic Journal of Statistics, Vol. 8 pp. 646-677

Item.Title: Obtain Figure 2 of p.
Compare psi function for two values of parameter k.
Parameters associated to a value of bdp=1/2.
